intro: Lastrea gretheri, commonly known as the Cape Town star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Lastrea gretheri is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
